Definition.WordDefinition:
Dodo amatory; loving. (1.) A descendant of Issachar (Judg. 10:1).
(2.) An Ahohite, father of Eleazar, who was one of David's three heroes (2 Sam. 23:9; 1 Chr. 11:12). He was the same with Dodai mentioned in 1 Chr. 27:4.
(3.) A Bethlehemite, and father of Elhanan, who was one of David's thirty heroes (2 Sam. 23:24).

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Dodo \Do"do\, n.; pl. {Dodoes}. [Said to be fr. Pg. doudo silly, foolish (cf. {Booby}); this is fr. Prov. E. dold, the same word as E. dolt.] (Zo["o]l.) A large, extinct bird ({Didus ineptus}), formerly inhabiting the Island of Mauritius. It had short, half-fledged wings, like those of the ostrich, and a short neck and legs; -- called also {dronte}. It was related to the pigeons. [1913 Webster]
dodo n 1: someone whose style is out of fashion [syn: {fogy}, {fogey}, {fossil}] 2: extinct heavy flightless bird of Mauritius related to pigeons [syn: {Raphus cucullatus}] [also: {dodoes} (pl)]
